article_node.title: Vaccine expert who is a frequent critic of RFK Jr. is blocked from participating in FDA advisory committee
article_node.summary: Dr. Paul Offit, a prominent vaccine scientist and critic of HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., was barred from serving on the FDA’s Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee after his term expired and paperwork was reportedly held up by HHS. The move follows Kennedy’s broader purge of CDC and FDA vaccine advisers amid accusations of conflicts of interest and a push for stricter vaccine oversight. Offit’s exclusion highlights tensions between public health experts and the current administration’s vaccine policy direction.
